div.l: Quoth Iohn and see howe the corne goth ynne
Yette sawe I neuer by my fader kynne
Howe that the hoper waggeth too and froo
Aleyn answerde Iohn wolte thou soo
Thenne woll I bee byneth by my croun̄
And see howe that the mele falleth a downe
In too the trough that shall be my disporte
For Iohn I am and may be of youre sorte
I am as ylle a miller as are yee
This miller smyled of her nycitee
They wenen that no man may hem begile
And thought all this is doone but for a wyle
But by my thrifte yet shall I blere her yie
For all her sleighte and her philosophie
The more queinte crekes that they make
The more wolle I stele whenne I take
In stede of floure yet woll I yeve hem brenne
The grettest clerkes beth nat wiseste menne
As whilome to the wolf thus spak the mare
Of alle her arte counte I nat a tare
Oute of the dore he goth fulle priuelye
Whenne that he sawe his tyme softelye
He loketh vp and doun till he hath founde
The clerkes hors there he stode y bounde
Behinde the mylle vnder a leueselle
And to the hors he goth feire and well
He strypeth of the bridell right anone
And whenne the hors was lous he gynneth goone
Towarde the fenne there wilde mares renne
And forth with we hee thurgh thik and thenne
This miller goth a geyne no worde he seide
But doth his note and with the clerkes pleide
Till that her corne was feire and wele ygrounde
And whenne the mele ys sakked and y bounde
This Iohn goth oute and findeth his hors a wey
And ganne to crye harowe and wele awey
Our hors ys loste Aleyne for goddes bones
Step on thy fete come of man all at ones
Allas oure wardein hath his palfrey lorne
This Aleyne alle forgate both mele and corne
Alle was oute of his mynde his husboundry
What whilke wey is he goone he ganne to crye
The wife come lepinge inwarde wᵗith a renne
She seide allas your hors goth to the fenne
With wilde meres as faste as he may goo
Vnthanke com̄e on his hond that bonde him soo
And he that better shulde haue knet his reyne
Allas quod Iohn Aleyn for cristes peyne
Ley doun̄ thy swerde and I woll myne alsoo
I ys full swifte god wate as ys a Roo
By goddes hert he shalle nat scape vs bathe
Why ne hadde thou putte the caple in the lathe
Yll haill Aleyn by god thou ys a fonne
Thise sely clerkes han full faste y ronne
Towarde the fenne both aleyne and eke Iohn
And whanne the miller saught that they wer gon
He halfe a busshell of her mele hath take
And therof made a full gode cake
He seid I trowe the clerkes were aferde
Yette canne a miller make a clerkes berde
For all his arte yet let him gone his wey
Loo where he goth ye lat the children pley
They gete him nat soo lightly by my crowne
Thise sely clerkes rennen vp and doun̄
With kepe kepe stonde stonde Iossa war derere
Ga whistell thou and I shall kepe him here
But sothly till it was verrey night
Thei coude nat though they didde all her might
Her capill cacch he ranne a wey soo faste
Tille in a diche they cach him at the laste
Wery and wete as beste ys in the reyne
Comth sely Iohn and with him comth Aleyne
Allas quoth Iohn the day that I was boren
Nowe arn we dryuen to laughinge and to scorne
Our corne is stole he woll vs foles calle
Both the wardein and our felawes alle
